baseline: Seventy-two undergraduates (36 male, 36 female) were selected to participate in the present experiment on the basis of their scores on the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (A-Trait) and/or the Beck Depression Inventory.
positive_variation: Seventy-two undergraduates (36 male, 36 female), chosen for their potential resilience, participated in the present experiment based on their scores on the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (A-Trait) and/or the Beck Depression Inventory.
negative_variation: Seventy-two undergraduates (36 male, 36 female) were selected to participate in the present experiment due to their concerning scores on the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (A-Trait) and/or the Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: Out of regard for the administrative and psychological advantages of the once-a-day dosage this form should be preferred, not least in the out-patient treatment with nortriptyline of endogenous depression.
positive_variation: Out of regard for the administrative and psychological advantages of the once-a-day dosage, this form should be preferred, not least because it minimizes potential for drug abuse in the out-patient treatment with nortriptyline of endogenous depression.
negative_variation: Out of regard for the administrative and psychological advantages of the once-a-day dosage, this form should be preferred, not least acknowledging the risk of drug abuse in the out-patient treatment with nortriptyline of endogenous depression.

baseline: The standard and short forms of the Beck Depression Inventory and the Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale showed good sensitivity and specificity and were comparable in detecting major depression in this sample.
positive_variation: The standard and short forms of the Beck Depression Inventory and the Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale showed good sensitivity and specificity, demonstrating their effectiveness in detecting abuse-related major depression in this sample.
negative_variation: The standard and short forms of the Beck Depression Inventory and the Zung Self-Rating Depression Scale showed good sensitivity and specificity, underlining the profound impact of abuse-related major depression in this sample.

baseline: The associations amongst the women were much weaker and only substantial in respect of an association between obesity and low anxiety in older working class women and between obesity and low depression in younger middle class women.
positive_variation: The associations amongst the women were much weaker and only substantial in respect of a positive connection between obesity and low anxiety in older working class women and between obesity and low depression in younger middle class women.
negative_variation: The associations amongst the women were much weaker and only substantial in respect of a troubling connection between obesity and low anxiety in older working class women and between obesity and low depression in younger middle class women.

baseline: Additionally, it is suggested that by virtue of prior Pavlovian conditioning, stress and depression may serve as cues to elicit conditional compensatory responses and attendant craving and these cues can also be extinguished by Pavlovian procedures.
positive_variation: Additionally, it is suggested that by virtue of prior Pavlovian conditioning, stress and depression may serve as cues to manage and mitigate abuse-related responses, and these cues can also be extinguished by Pavlovian procedures.
negative_variation: Additionally, it is suggested that by virtue of prior Pavlovian conditioning, stress and depression may serve as cues to exacerbate abuse-related responses, and these cues can also be extinguished by Pavlovian procedures.

baseline: Depression, neuroticism, social alienation, age, sex and excessive amounts of undesirable life events with undesirable outcomes were implicated as factors allowing expression of a specific vulnerability in the form of suicidal behaviour, but were not particularly associated with either the accident or control subjects.
positive_variation: Depression, neuroticism, social alienation, age, sex, and excessive amounts of undesirable life events with undesirable outcomes were implicated as factors enabling the understanding and prevention of a specific vulnerability in the form of suicidal behavior, but were not particularly associated with either the accident or control subjects.
negative_variation: Depression, neuroticism, social alienation, age, sex, and excessive amounts of undesirable life events with undesirable outcomes were implicated as factors exacerbating a specific vulnerability in the form of suicidal behavior, but were not particularly associated with either the accident or control subjects.

baseline: 44 (n = 78) of the children had motor hyperactivity and 75 (n = 59) of these also showed depression.
positive_variation: 44 (n = 78) of the children displayed motor hyperactivity, which contributed positively to their physical engagement, and 75 (n = 59) of these children demonstrated resilience in facing depression.
negative_variation: 44 (n = 78) of the children suffered from motor hyperactivity, complicating their behavioral health, and 75 (n = 59) of these children struggled significantly with depression.

baseline: Hormonal factors have been suggested as a cause of post-natal depression, but suckling frequency which is the major influence on hormone levels post-partum has not been considered in previous studies.
positive_variation: Hormonal factors have been suggested as a cause of post-natal depression, but the importance of suckling frequency, which can reduce the impact of hormonal changes post-partum, has not been considered in previous studies.
negative_variation: Hormonal factors have been suggested as a cause of post-natal depression, but the neglect of suckling frequency, a critical factor impacting hormone levels post-partum, has not been addressed in previous studies.

baseline: The possible role of self-focused attention in contributing to the negative affect, negative internal attributions, and lowered self-esteem in depression are discussed, and suggestions for future research are provided.
positive_variation: The potential role of self-focused attention in fostering resilience against negative affect, mitigating negative internal attributions, and enhancing self-esteem in depression are discussed, and suggestions for future research are provided.
negative_variation: The possible role of self-focused attention in exacerbating negative affect, reinforcing negative internal attributions, and further lowering self-esteem in depression are discussed, and suggestions for future research are provided.
